text:
e="preserve">Alfred Emanuel Smith IV (May 24, 1951 – November 20, 2019) was an American Wall Street executive. He was born in New York City. Smith IV was a Senior Advisor for the Marwood Group. He was a volunteer and member of many charitable boards, including the Tony Blair Faith Foundation, and Mutual of America. and was Chairman of the Board of Saint Vincent's Catholic Medical Center.
He was the great-grandson of Al Smith, Governor of New York (1919–1920, 1923–1928) and 1928 Democratic presidential nominee.
Smith IV died at his home in New Canaan, Connecticut of a heart attack on November 20, 2019 at the age of 68.
